title: Enhancing Instructional Design Capabilities for MOOC Development and Operation: Short-Intensive Mathematics Education Course Based on Mobile Microlearning

context.prior_knowledge: College-level foundational mathematics knowledge (algebra, geometry, statistics) and experience using online learning platforms
context.additional_context: Course to enhance math MOOC development/operation competencies in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments. Emphasizes project-based learning for working professionals, focusing on computational problem-solving and data visualization skill development

learning_goals: Learners Can Explain at Least Three Technical and Legal Constraints (Copyright, Time Management, etc.) in MOOC Design Through Mathematical Modeling
Learners Can Apply a Step-by-Step Process for Producing Mobile-Optimized Microlearning Content (e.g., Mathematical Expression Rendering, Graph Visualization)
Learners Can Write a Draft Operational Plan for a Mathematics MOOC Applicable to Real Educational Settings Through Project-Based Assessment

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
